panels.content:
![logo image](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/marinebon/mbon-dashboard-server/client-fwc/static_files/FWC_DB_imagepanel_sized.png)

Select a specific location using the "Locations" dropdown menu at left.

Display mean, climatology, or anomalies of extracted satellite data using the "Time-series display metric" menu at left.

The range of the displayed time period can be adjusted at top right.

Locations of extracted data:
* SLI: St. Lucie River inlet
* PBI: Palm Beach inlet
* PEV: Port Everglades
* MIA: Miami
* MOL: Molasses Reef
* SOM: Sombrero Key
* SUG: Sugarloaf Key
* KW: Key West
panels.title: General Information
MODIS-Aqua Algal Bloom Index 7-Day Anomaly Images (W/m^2/um/sr)
VIIRS Reflectance at 671nm 7-day Anomaly Images (turbidity proxy)
VIIRS Reflectance at 671nm 7-day Anomaly Images (turbidity proxy)
Cumulative percent of sampling sites infected

targets.query:
SELECT mean("anomaly") AS anomaly FROM "viirs_sstn"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

SELECT mean("anomaly") AS anomaly FROM "viirs_chlor_a"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

SELECT mean("anomaly") AS anomaly FROM "modis_abi"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

SELECT mean("anomaly") AS anomaly FROM "viirs_rrs_671"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

SELECT mean("anomaly") AS anomaly FROM "viirs_kd_490"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

SELECT mean("mean") AS mean FROM "river_discharge"
WHERE ("location" = 'FWCdb_EFL') AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

panels.title: Gage height from rivers on Florida's east coast (sum of gage height from rivers shown by red circles on map)

targets.query:
SELECT mean("mean") AS mean FROM "river_discharge"
WHERE ("location" = 'FKdb') AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

panels.title: USGS River Discharge Height (sum of discharge from green dots on map)

panels.description: TODO: add other bouys to overview map?

targets.query:
SELECT mean("anomaly") AS anomaly FROM "bouy_sal"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Bouys$/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

panels.title: In-situ salinity (psu) from selected buoys

targets.query:
SELECT mean("anomaly") AS anomaly FROM "bouy_temp"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Bouys$/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

panels.content:
The following data products are available for download via http or ftp:

* [MODIS & VIIRS Satellite .tif Images
     - [From FWC](ftp://ftp.floridamarine.org/users/ism/sctld/USF/)
     - From USF IMaRS
        * [Ocean Color](http://imars-webserver-01.marine.usf.edu/fk/TIFF_out/OC/)
        * [Sea Surface Temperature](http://imars-webserver-01.marine.usf.edu/fk/TIFF_out/SSTN/)
     - From USF IMaRS (2)
        * [MODIS](http://imars-webserver-01.marine.usf.edu/fk/TIFF_out_MODA)
        * [VIIRS](http://imars-webserver-01.marine.usf.edu/fk/TIFF_out_VSNPP)
* [HYCOM & Bathymetry Data @ FWC](ftp://ftp.floridamarine.org/users/ism/sctld/)
* USGS River Discharge @ IMaRS
    - [per-river .txt files](http://imars-webserver-01.marine.usf.edu/fk/DISCH_CSV_USGS)
    - [west & east summary .csv files](http://imars-webserver-01.marine.usf.edu/fk/USGS_tmp)
* [MODIS Time Series .csv @ IMaRS](http://imars-webserver-01.marine.usf.edu/fk/EXT_TS_MODA)
* [VIIRS Time Series .csv @ IMaRS](http://imars-webserver-01.marine.usf.edu/fk/EXT_TS_VSNPP)
* [Coral Disease Time Series Map Images @ IMaRS](http://imars-webserver-01.marine.usf.edu/fk/FWC_CD_maps)
* [Bouy Salinity & Temperature @ IMaRS](http://imars-webserver-01.marine.usf.edu/fk/NDBC_tmp)
panels.title: Download The Data
